page.title: 03ATTENBOROUGH. The Village.
page.content: The white painted Railway station, the Nature Reserve, Church, a few shops,some large old houses and a lot more newer smaller ones make up Attenborough village. The people of Attenborough are mainly retired or commuters, who commute each day into Beeston or Nottingham. The thirteenth century spire of Attenborough church stands out from the village centre. It was built on a gravel mound higher than the surrounding flood plain and is flanked on one side by the Nature Reserve. The Powtrell family,William Charlton, Admiral Sir Borlace Warren and Henry Ireton all have conections with it. The most well known {HENRY IRETON ,Cromwells son-in-law was born in the house which stands on the western side of the church and lived in a house long since demolished in the village.
